sen.j: 平賀 源内（ひらが げんない、享保13年（1728年）- 安永8年12月18日 (旧暦)（1780年1月24日））は江戸時代の日本の本草学者、蘭学者、医者、作家、発明家、画家（蘭画家）である。
sen.e: Gennai HIRAGA(1728 - January 24, 1780) is a Japanese herbalism scholar, Dutch scholar, physician, writer, inventor, and Western painter in Edo period.
Gennai HIRAGA (1728 - January 24, 1780) was a scholar of Japanese herbalism and Dutch, as well as a physician, writer, inventor and Western-style painter, in the Edo period.
Gennai HIRAGA (1728 - January 24, 1780) was a scholar of Japanese herbalism and Dutch, as well as a physician, writer, inventor and Western-style painter, in the Edo period.

sen.j: 諱は国倫（くにとも）、号は鳩渓（きゅうけい）・風来山人・福内鬼外（ふくうちきがい）・貧家銭内（ひんかぜにない）など。
sen.e: His posthumous name is Kunitomo, and his pen name are Kyukei, Furai Sanjin, Fukuuchi Kigai, Hinka Zeninai, etc.
His posthumous name was Kunitomo, and his pen names were Kyukei, Furai Sanjin, Fukuuchi Kigai, Hinka Zeninai, etc.
His pen names included Kyukei, Furai Sanjin, Fukuuchi Kigai, and Hinka Zeninai, and his posthumous name was Kunitomo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 通称は源内、元内とも。
sen.e: His common name was Gennai (源内, also written as 元内).
His common name was Gennai (源内, also written as 元内).
His nickname was Gennai (源内, also written as 元内).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 父は白石茂左衛門（良房）、母は山下氏の娘。
sen.e: His father is Mozaemon SHIRAISHI (Yoshifusa), and mother is from the Yamashita clan.
His father was Mozaemon SHIRAISHI (Yoshifusa), and his mother was from the Yamashita clan.
His father was Mozaemon SHIRAISHI (Yoshifusa), and his mother was from the Yamashita clan.

sen.j: 兄弟多数。
sen.e: He had many siblings.
He had many siblings.
He had quite a few siblings.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 讃岐国寒川郡 (讃岐国)志度浦（現在の香川県さぬき市志度）に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Shidoura, Samukawa County, Sanuki Province (present Shido, Sanuki City, Kagawa Prefecture).
He was born in Shidoura, Samukawa County, Sanuki Province (the present-day Shido, Sanuki City, Kagawa Prefecture).
He was born in Shidoura, Samukawa County, Sanuki Province (present-day Shido, Sanuki City, Kagawa Prefecture).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 平賀氏は高松藩の足軽身分の家。
sen.e: The Hiraga clan was an ashigaru (common foot soldier) family of Takamatsu Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Hiraga clan was an ashigaru (common foot soldier) family of the Takamatsu domain.
The Hiraga clan was a family of 'foot soldier' called 'ashigaru' of the Takamatsu Domain.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 元々は信濃国佐久郡の豪族だったが、戦国時代平賀源心の代に甲斐の武田信虎・武田信玄父子に滅ぼされた。
sen.e: Although they were once a local ruling family of Saku County, Shinano Province, the clan was defeated by Nobutora TAKEDA and his son Shingen TAKEDA when Genshin HIRAGA was the family head.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although they were once a local ruling family of Saku County, Shinano Province, the clan was defeated by Nobutora TAKEDA and his son Shingen TAKEDA when Genshin HIRAGA was the family head.

Although the Hiraga clan was once a local ruling family of Saku County, Shinano Province, the clan was defeated by Nobutora TAKEDA and his son Shingen TAKEDA during the Period of Warring States that was when Genshin HIRAGA was the clan head.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後陸奥国の白石市に移り伊達氏に仕え、白石姓に改めた。
sen.e: Then they moved to Shiroishi city, Mutsu Province and served the Date clan under the renamed family name, Shiroishi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then moved to Shiroishi City, Mutsu Province, and served the Date clan under the renamed family name, Shiroishi.
Then those survived moved to Shiroishi City, Mutsu Province, and served the Date clan under the renamed family name, Shiroishi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: のちに宇和島藩主家に従い四国へ下り、讃岐で帰農したという。
sen.e: Later, they moved to Shikoku region following the Lord of Uwajima Domain and took up farming again in Sanuki.
Later, they moved to the Shikoku region following the Lord of the Uwajima domain, and took up farming again in Sanuki.
Later, they moved to the Shikoku region following the Lord of the Uwajima Domain, and returned to farming again in Sanuki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 幼少の頃には掛け軸に細工をして「神酒」を作成したとされる。
sen.e: It is told that Gennai made "religious libation" by tooling a hanging scroll when he was a child.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that when he was a child, Gennai created a work depicting a "sacred libation" by tooling a hanging scroll.
It is said that when he was a child, Gennai created a work depicting a 'sacred libation' by tooling a hanging scroll.

sen.j: その評判が元で13歳から藩医の元で本草学を学び、儒教を学ぶ。
sen.e: With this reputation, he started studying herbalism and Confucianism under a medical doctor at age of 13.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With this reputation, at the age of 13 he started studying herbalism and Confucianism under a medical doctor.
Due to that reputation, at the age of 13 he started studying herbalism and Confucianism under a medical doctor.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、俳諧グループに属して俳諧なども行う。
sen.e: Moreover, he belonged to a haikai group and composed haikai, etc.
Moreover, he belonged to a haikai group and composed haikai, etc.
Moreover, he did activities including becoming a member of a haikai (humorous linked verse) group and composing haikai.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 寛延元年（1748年）に父の死により後役として藩の蔵番となる。
sen.e: In 1748, after his father's death, he became an accounting officer succeeding his farther.
In 1748, after his father's death, he became an accounting officer and succeeded his father.
In 1748, after his father's death, he became an accounting officer and succeeded his father.

sen.j: 宝暦2年（1752年）頃に1年間長崎へ遊学し、本草学とオランダ語、医学、油絵などを学ぶ。
sen.e: Around 1752, he studied herbalism, Dutch, medicine, oil painting, etc. in Nagasaki for one year.
Around 1752, he studied herbalism, Dutch, medicine, oil painting, etc., in Nagasaki for one year.
Circa 1752, he studied herbalism, Dutch, medicine, oil painting, etc., in Nagasaki for one year.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 留学の後に藩の役目を辞し、妹に婿養子を迎えさせて家督を放棄する。
sen.e: After studying in Nagasaki, he resigned the duty of the feudal domain and abandoned the headship of the family by adopting his younger sister's husband.
After studying in Nagasaki, he resigned from his duties to the feudal domain and abandoned the headship of the family by adopting his younger sister's husband.
After studying in Nagasaki, he resigned from his duties to the feudal domain and abandoned the headship of the family by adopting his younger sister's husband.

sen.j: 大阪、京都で学び、さらに宝暦6年（1756年）には江戸に出て本草学者田村元雄（藍水）に弟子入りして本草学を学ぶ。
sen.e: He studyed in Osaka and Kyoto, and in 1756, he went to Edo and became a pupil of herbalism scholar Genyu TAMURA (Ransui) to study herbalism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He studied in Osaka and Kyoto, and in 1756 he went to Edo and became a pupil of the herbalism scholar Genyu TAMURA (Ransui), whereupon he studied herbalism.
He studied in Osaka and Kyoto, and in 1756 he went to Edo and became a pupil of the herbalism scholar Genyu TAMURA (Ransui), whereupon he studied herbalism.

sen.j: 漢学を習得するために林家にも入門して聖堂に寄宿する。
sen.e: He was also admitted to the Hayashi family to learn Sinology and boarded at a church.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He was also admitted to the Hayashi family in order to learn Sinology, and he boarded at a church.
He was also admitted to the Hayashi family in order to learn Sinology, and he boarded at the Sacred Hall at Yushima.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 2回目の長崎遊学では鉱山の採掘や精錬の技術を学ぶ。
sen.e: On his second study in Nagasaki, he learned mining and refining technology.
In his second period of study in Nagasaki, he learned mining and refining technology.
In his second period of study in Nagasaki, he learned mining and refining technology.

sen.j: 宝暦11年（1761年）には伊豆で鉱床を発見し、産物のブローカーなども行う。
sen.e: He discovered a mineral deposit in Izu in 1761 and also worked as a broker of products.
He discovered a mineral deposit in Izu in 1761, and also worked as a broker of products.
He discovered a mineral deposit in Izu in 1761, becoming a broker of products.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この頃には幕府老中の田沼意次にも知られるようになる。
sen.e: He came to be recognized by roju (member of shogun's council of elders) Okitsugu TANUMA at these days.
He came to be recognized by the roju (member of the shogun's council of elders), Okitsugu TANUMA, during this period.
He was recognized by a member of the shogun's council of elders 'roju', Okitsugu TANUMA, during this period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 物産博覧会を度々開催し、宝暦12年（1762年）には物産会として第五回となる「東都薬品会」を江戸の湯島にて開催する。
sen.e: He frequently held product expositions and opened the Toto Yakuhinkai (medicine fair) in Yushima, Edo as the fifth product exposition in 1762.
He frequently held product expositions and opened the Toto Yakuhinkai (medicine fair) in Yushima, Edo as the fifth product exposition in 1762.
He frequently held product expositions, and in 1762, opened the medicine fair 'Toto Yakuhinkai' in Yushima, Edo as the fifth product exposition.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸においては知名度も上がり、杉田玄白らと交友する。
sen.e: He became well known in Edo and associated with Genpaku SUGITA and others.
He became well known in Edo, and associated with Genpaku SUGITA and others.
He became well known in Edo, and associated with Genpaku SUGITA and others.

sen.j: 高松藩の家臣として再登用されるが、学問に専念するために辞職する。
sen.e: Although he was re-appointed as a vassal of the Takamatsu Domain, he resigned in order to concentrate on scholarship.
Although he was reappointed as a vassal of the Takamatsu domain, he resigned in order to concentrate on scholarship.
Although he was reappointed as a vassal of the Takamatsu Domain, he resigned in order to concentrate on scholarship.

sen.j: 宝暦13年（1763年）には『物類品隲』を刊行。
sen.e: He published "Butsurui Hnshitsu (Classification of various materials)" in 1763.
He published "Butsurui Honshitsu (Classification of Various Materials)" in 1763.
He published a book on classification of various materials "Butsurui Honshitsu" in 1763.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: オランダ博物学に関心を持ち、洋書の入手に専念する。
sen.e: He got interested in Dutch natural history, and devoted to procurement of foreign books.
He became interested in Dutch natural history, and devoted himself to the procurement of foreign books.
He became interested in Dutch natural history, and devoted himself to the procurement of foreign books.

sen.j: 源内は語学知識が無く、オランダ通詞に読み分けさせて読解に務める。
sen.e: Since Gennai did not have language skill, he let translating officer read in order to comprehend.
Because Gennai wasn't skilled enough in the language, he let a translating officer read in order to comprehend.
Because Gennai had not become skilled enough in the language, he let a translating officer read in order to comprehend.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 文芸活動も行い、談義本の類を執筆する。
sen.e: He also did some literature activities and wrote dangibon (comical stories popular in the Edo period).
He also engaged in some literary activities and wrote dangibon (comical stories that were popular during the Edo period).
He also engaged in some literary activities and wrote dangibon (comical stories that were popular during the Edo period).

sen.j: 明和年間には産業起業的な活動も行った。
sen.e: During the Meiwa era, he was also an entrepreneur.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During the Meiwa era, he was also an entrepreneur.
During the Meiwa era, he was also an entrepreneur.

sen.j: 安永2年（1773年）には秋田藩の佐竹義敦に招かれて鉱山開発の指導を行う。
sen.e: In 1773, He was invited by Yoshiatsu SATAKE to teach mining development.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1773, he was invited by Yoshiatsu SATAKE to teach mining development.
In 1773, he was invited by Yoshiatsu SATAKE to teach mining development.

sen.j: また秋田藩士小田野直武に蘭画の技法を伝える。
sen.e: Moreover, he taught Western painting technique to Naotake
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, he taught Western painting techniques to Naotake.
Moreover, he taught Western painting techniques to Naotake ODANO who was the feudal retainer of the Akita clan.
sen.cmt: ODANO who was the feudal retainer of the Akita clan.補足

sen.j: 秩父地方における炭焼、荒川 (関東)通船工事の指導なども行う。
sen.e: He also instructed charcoal making in the Chichibu district and passage construction in Ara-kawa River (Kanto region), etc.
He also taught charcoal making in the Chichibu district and passage construction at the Ara-kawa River (Kanto region), etc.
He also taught making charcoal in the Chichibu district and passage construction at the Ara-kawa River (Kanto region).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在でも奥秩父の中津峡付近には、源内が設計し長く逗留した建物が「源内居」として残っている。
sen.e: Around Nakatsukyo, Okuchichibu, a building that was designed by Gennai and where he had stayed for a long time, still remains as "Kennaikyo" at present.
Around Nakatsukyo, Okuchichibu, a building that was designed by Gennai, and in which he had stayed for a long time, remains as "Kennaikyo" in the present day.
Near to Nakatsukyo, Okuchichibu, a building that Gennai designed and stayed for a long time, remains as "Gennaikyo" in the present day.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 安永5年（1776年）には長崎で手に入れたエレキテル（静電気発生機）を修理して復元する。
sen.e: In 1776, he fixed and restored Erekiteru (electrostatic generator) that he had obtained in Nagasaki
In 1776, he fixed and restored an erekiteru (electrostatic generator) that he had obtained in Nagasaki.
In 1776, he fixed and restored an electrostatic generator 'erekiteru' that he had obtained in Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 安永8年（1779年）夏には橋本町の邸へ移る。
sen.e: He moved to the residence of Hashimoto-cho in the summer of 1779.
He moved to the residence of Hashimoto-cho in the summer of 1779.
He moved to the residence of Hashimoto-cho in the summer of 1779.

sen.j: 11月21日、誤って（一説に、「乱心して」）2人を殺傷して投獄される。
sen.e: On November 21st, he killed two persons by accident (some people say "by insanity"), and he was imprisoned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On November 21, he killed two persons by accident (some people say "by insanity"), and he was imprisoned.
On November 21, he killed two people by mistake, or "by insanity" according to some opinion, and he was imprisoned.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 12月18日獄死、享年52。
sen.e: He died in prison on December 18th at the age of 52.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He died in prison on December 18 at the age of 52.
He died in prison on December 18 at the age of 52.

sen.j: 杉田玄白らの手により葬儀が行われたが、幕府の許可が下りず、墓碑もなく、遺体もないままの葬儀となった。
sen.e: His funeral was held by Genpaku SUGITA and others without Gennai's body nor gravestone since they couldn't get government's permission.
His funeral was held by Genpaku SUGITA and others without Gennai's body or a gravestone, since they couldn't obtain the government's permission.
His funeral was held by Genpaku SUGITA and others without Gennai's body or a gravestone, since they were not permitted to have them.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただし晩年については諸説あり、大工の秋田屋九五郎を殺したとも、後年逃げ延びて田沼意次の保護下に天寿を全うしたとも伝えられる。
sen.e: However, there have been various views in his later years, such as that he killed carpenter kyugoro AKITAYA and that he escaped and died a natural death under the protection of Okitsugu TANUMA.
sen.cmt: 秋田屋九五郎：読み方確認できず
sen.e: However, there have been various views in later years, such as that he killed the carpenter Kyugoro AKITAYA and that he escaped and died a natural death under the protection of Okitsugu TANUMA.
However, there have been various views in later years, such as that he killed the carpenter Kyugoro AKITAYA and that he escaped and died a natural death under the protection of Okitsugu TANUMA.

sen.j: 戒名は智見霊雄。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name is Chimireiyu.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Chimireiyu.
His posthumous Buddhist name was Chimireiyu.

sen.j: 墓所は浅草の総泉寺。
sen.e: His cemetery is in Sosen-ji Temple in Asakusa.
His cemetery is in Sosen-ji Temple, in Asakusa.
His cemetery is in Sosen-ji Temple, in Asakusa.

sen.j: 天才、または異才の人と称される。
sen.e: Gennai is called genius or a man of exceptional talent.
Gennai has been called a genius or a man of exceptional talent.
Gennai has been called a genius or a man of exceptional talent.

sen.j: 鎖国を行っていた当時の日本で、蘭学者として油絵や鉱山開発など外国の文化・技術を紹介した。
sen.e: As a Dutch scholar, he introduced foreign culture and technology, such as oil painting and mining development when Japan had closed its doors to the outside world.
As a Dutch scholar, he introduced foreign culture and technology, such as oil painting and mining development, when Japan had closed its doors to the outside world.
As a Dutch scholar, he introduced foreign culture and technology, such as oil painting and mining development, when Japan had closed its doors to the outside world.

sen.j: 文学者としても戯作の開祖とされる。
sen.e: Moreover, as a writer, he is considered the father of light readings,
Moreover, as a writer he is considered the father of light reading.
Moreover, as a writer he is considered the father of light reading.

sen.j: 人形浄瑠璃などに多くの作品を残し、また平賀焼などの焼き物を作成したり、多彩な分野で活躍した。
sen.e: He was also active in many fields, for example, writing many plays, such as, for ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater) and making potteries, such as Hiraga yaki (pottery).
He was also active in many fields, including playwriting such as for ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theatre) and making pottery such as Hiraga yaki (pottery).
He was also active in many fields, including playwriting such as for traditional Japanese puppet theatre 'Ningyo Joruri' and making pottery such as 'Hiraga yaki'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 男色家であった為、生涯にわたって妻帯せず、歌舞伎役者らを贔屓にして愛したという。
sen.e: It is said that since he was a homosexual, he remained single for the lifetime and favored and loved Kabuki actors.
It is said that since he was a homosexual, he remained single throughout his life, but that he favored and loved Kabuki actors.
It is said that since he was a homosexual, he remained single throughout his life, but that he favored and loved Kabuki actors.

sen.j: わけても、2代目瀬川菊之丞 （瀬川路考）との仲は有名。
sen.e: Especially, his relationship with Kikunojo SEGAWA II (Roko SEGAWA) is famous.
Particularly, his relationship with Kikunojo SEGAWA II (Roko SEGAWA) is famous.
Particularly, his relationship with Kikunojo SEGAWA II (Roko SEGAWA) is well-known.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 『解体新書』を翻訳した杉田玄白をはじめ、当時の蘭学者の間に源内の盛名は広く知られていた。
sen.e: Gennai's reputation was widely spread among Dutch scholars of those days including Genpaku SUGITA who translated a Dutch anatomical text, "Kaitai Shinsho".
Gennai's reputation was widely spread among Dutch scholars of those days, including Genpaku SUGITA, who translated a Dutch anatomical text, "Kaitai Shinsho.".
Gennai's reputation was widely spread among Dutch scholars of those days, including Genpaku SUGITA, who translated a Dutch anatomical text, "Kaitai Shinsho."

sen.j: 玄白の回想録である『蘭学事始』は、源内との対話に一章を割いている。
sen.e: Genpaku devoted one chapter to dialogs with Gennai in his reminiscences titled "Rangaku Kotohajime (The Beginning of Dutch Studies)".
Genpaku devoted one chapter to dialogs with Gennai in his reminiscences called "Rangaku Kotohajime (The Beginning of Dutch Studies)."
Genpaku devoted one chapter to dialogs with Gennai in his reminiscences called "Rangaku Kotohajime".
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 源内の墓碑を記したのも玄白である。
sen.e: It was Genpaku who wrote on Gennai's tombstone as follows:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was Genpaku who wrote on Gennai's tombstone as follows:
It was Genpaku who wrote on Gennai's tombstone as follows:

sen.j: 「嗟非常人、好非常事、行是非常、何死非常」（ああ非常の人、非常のことを好み、行いこれ非常、何ぞ非常に死するや（貴方は常識とは違う人で、常識とは違うものを好み、常識とは違うことをする、しかし、死ぬとき位は畳の上で普通に死んで欲しかった。））
sen.e: "Oh, how extraordinary you were. You favored extraordinary things and have done extraordinary deeds. But I wanted you to die ordinarily on a tatami mat."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Oh, how extraordinary you were. You favored extraordinary things and have done extraordinary deeds. But I wanted you to die ordinarily on a tatami mat."
"Oh, how extraordinary you were. You favored extraordinary things and have done extraordinary deeds. But I wanted you to die ordinarily on a tatami mat."

sen.j: とあり、源内の才能に玄白が驚嘆しその死を惜しんだことが伺われる。
sen.e: It appears that Genpaku admired Gennai's talent and lamented his death.
It appears that Genpaku admired Gennai's talent and lamented his death.
It appears that Genpaku admired Gennai's talent and lamented his death.

sen.j: 科学者としての業績には、オランダ製の静電気発生装置エレキテルの紹介、火浣布の開発がある。
sen.e: His achievements as a scientist include presenting Dutch electrostatic generator, Erekiteru, and development of kakanpu (asbestous cloth).
His achievements as a scientist include presenting the Dutch electrostatic generator, erekiteru, and the development of kakanpu (asbestos cloth).
His achievements as a scientist include presenting the Dutch electrostatic generator, erekiteru, and the development of asbestos cloth, kakanpu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 一説には竹とんぼの発明者とも言われ、これを史上初のプロペラとする人もいる。
sen.e: Some people say that he is the inventor of a simple helicopter-like bamboo toy that may be the first propeller in history.
Some people say he was the inventor of a simple helicopter-like bamboo toy that may have been the first propeller in history.
Some people say he was the inventor of a simple helicopter-like bamboo toy that may have been the first propeller in history.

sen.j: 気球や電気の研究なども実用化寸前までこぎ着けていたと言われる。
sen.e: It is also said that his research on gas bag, electricity, etc. were close to practical use.
It is also said that his research efforts in regard to gas bags, electricity, etc., were close to practical use.
It is also said that his research efforts in regard to gas bags and electricity were also close to practical use.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、結局これらは実用的研究には一切結びついておらず、後世の評価を二分する一因となっている。
sen.e: However, the fact that these are not connected with practical research after all is one of the reasons to polarize present day's assessment of his works.
However, the fact that these are ultimately not connected with practical research is one of the reasons that the modern-day assessments of his works have become so polarized.
However, the fact that these are ultimately not connected with practical research is one of the reasons that the modern-day assessments of his works have become so polarized.

sen.j: 『エレキテル』は、故障していたオランダ製のものを修復したものであり、その原理については源内自身はよくわかっていなかったとする説が有力である。
sen.e: Many people believe that Gennai restored broken Dutch "Erekiteru" without fully understanding how it worked.
Many people believe that Gennai restored the broken Dutch "erekiteru" without fully understanding how it worked.
Many people believe that Gennai restored the broken Dutch "erekiteru" without fully understanding how it worked.

sen.j: 「夏バテ防止の為に土用の丑の日にウナギを食べる」風習は、夏場の売り上げ不振に悩んだ鰻屋に請われて、平賀源内が考案した「本日土用丑の日」という広告キャッチコピーが元との説が文政5年（1822年）の『明和誌』にある。
sen.e: According to " Meiwashi (a magazine)" in 1822, Gennai HIRAGA made a catchphrase "Today is Midsummer Day of the Ox" for an eel shop that suffered sale's slackness in summer, hence the customs of "eating an eel on Midsummer Day to prevent tiredness from the summer heat" began.

According to " Meiwashi (a magazine)" in 1822, Gennai HIRAGA made a catchphrase "Today is Midsummer Day of the Ox" for an eel shop that suffered slow sales in summer, whereby the custom of "eating an eel on Midsummer Day to prevent tiredness from the summer heat" began.

According to a magazine "Meiwashi" in 1822, Gennai HIRAGA coined the catchphrase "Today is Midsummer Day of the Ox" for an eel shop that suffered slow sales in summer, whereby the custom of 'eating an eel on Midsummer Day to prevent tiredness from the summer heat' began.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、明和6年（1769年）にはコマーシャルソングとされる、歯磨剤‎『漱石膏』の作詞作曲を手がけ、安永4年（1775年）には音羽屋多吉の清水餅の広告コピーを手がけた。
sen.e: Moreover, he composed and wrote a so called commercial song for a dentrifice, "Sosekiko" in 1769 and wrote a advertising copy for Takichi OTOWAYA's Kiyomizu mochi (rice cake) in 1775.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, he composed and wrote a so-called commercial song for a dentifrice, "Sosekiko," in 1769 and wrote advertising copy for Takichi OTOWAYA's Kiyomizu mochi (rice cake) in 1775.
Moreover, he composed and wrote a so-called commercial song for a dentifrice, "Sosekiko," in 1769 and wrote advertising copy for Takichi OTOWAYA's Kiyomizu mochi in 1775.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: それぞれ報酬を受けており、これらを以て日本におけるコピーライターのはしりとも評される。
sen.e: He received a reward for both works and is considered as one of the first copywriters in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He received a reward for both works and is considered as one of the first copywriters in Japan.
He received a reward for both works and is considered as one of the first copywriters in Japan.

sen.j: 浄瑠璃作家としては福内鬼外の筆名で執筆。
sen.e: As a Joruri play writer, he worked under the pen name Fukuuchi Kigai.
As a Joruri playwright, he worked under the pen name Fukuuchi Kigai.
As a Joruri playwright, he worked under the pen name Fukuuchi Kigai.

sen.j: 時代物を多く手がけた。
sen.e: He produced many period pieces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He produced many period pieces.
He produced many historical dramas.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 作品の多くは五段形式や多段形式で、世話物の要素が加わっていると評価される。
sen.e: Most of his works were Godan keishiki (five sections) or Tadan keishiki (multiple sections) and appraised that elements of ordinary people's lives are included.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Most of his works were godan keishiki (five sections) or tadan keishiki (multiple sections), and it has been said that they included elements of ordinary people's lives.
Most of his works were arranged in five sections or multiple sections, and it has been said that they included elements of ordinary people's lives.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 江戸に狂歌が流行するきっかけとなった大田南畝の『寝惚先生文集』に序文を寄せている。
sen.e: He also wrote a preface to Nanbo OTA's "Neboke Sensei Bunshu (Master Groggy 's Literary Collection)" which triggered a kyoka (comic (satirical) tanka) boom in Edo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He also wrote a preface to Nanbo OTA's "Neboke Sensei Bunshu (Master Groggy's Literary Collection)," which triggered a kyoka (comic (satirical) tanka) boom in Edo.
He also wrote a preface to Nanbo OTA's "Neboke Sensei Bunshu", which triggered a satirical poem 'kyoka' boom in Edo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、風来山人の筆名で、後世に傑作として名高い『長枕褥合戦』や『萎陰隠逸伝』などの春本まで残している。
sen.e: Moreover, he wrote pornographic books under the pen name of Furai Sanjin, such as, "Nagamakura shitone gassen (literally, battle of a long pillow and a bed)" and "Naemara initsuden", which have been recognized as masterpieces even in the future generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, he wrote pornographic books under the pen name Furai Sanjin, such as, "Nagamakura shitone gassen (literally, Battle of a Long Pillow and a Bed)" and "Naemara initsuden," which have been recognized as masterpieces by succeeding generations.
Moreover, he wrote pornographic books under the pen name Furai Sanjin, such as, "Nagamakura shitone gassen" and "Naemara initsuden," which have been recognized as masterpieces by later generations.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 衆道関連の著作として、水虎山人名義により 1764年(明和元年) に『菊の園』、安永4年（1775年）に『男色細見』の陰間茶屋案内書を著わした。
sen.e: Under the pen name of Suiko Sanjin, he published homosexual-related books, such as, Kagemajaya annaisho (guide book of kagema tea houses) of "Kiku no sono (garden of chrysanthemums)" in 1764 and "Nanshoku saiken (watching gay) " in 1775.

Under the pen name Suiko Sanjin, he published homosexual-related books such as, Kagemajaya annaisho (Guidebook of Kagema Tea Houses) of "Kiku no sono (Garden of Chrysanthemums)" in 1764 and "Nanshoku saiken (Watching Gay)" in 1775.
Under the pen name Suiko Sanjin, he published homosexual-related books such as, Kagemajaya Annaisho including "Kiku no sono" in 1764 and "Nanshoku saiken" in 1775.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 鈴木春信と共に絵暦交換会を催し、浮世絵の隆盛に一役買った。
sen.e: He played a role in the flourishing of Ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints), by holding picture calendar exchange parties with Harunobu SUZUKI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He played a role in the flourishing of Ukiyoe (Japanese woodblock prints), by holding picture-calendar exchange parties with Harunobu SUZUKI.
He played a role in the flourishing of Japanese woodblock prints 'Ukiyoe', by holding picture-calendar exchange parties with Harunobu SUZUKI.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また博覧会の開催を提案、江戸湯島で日本初の博覧会『東都薬品会』が開催された。
sen.e: Moreover, he proposed to open an exposition, and "Toto Yakuhinkai" was held in Yushima, Edo as the first exposition in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処『東都薬品会』について：前述と食い違っているようですが…
sen.e: Moreover, he proposed to open an exposition, and "Toto Yakuhinkai" was held in Yushima, Edo as the first exposition in Japan.
Moreover, he proposed to open an exposition, and "Toto Yakuhinkai" was held in Yushima, Edo as the first exposition in Japan.

sen.j: 文章の「起承転結」を説明する際によく使われる、文の作者との説がある。
sen.e: Some say that he was the author of the following phrase that is often cited to explain "introduction development turn and conclusion"of a composition:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Some say he was the author of the following phrase, which is often cited to explain the "introduction, development, turn and conclusion" of a composition:
Some say he was the author of the following phrase, which is often cited to explain the "introduction, development, turn and conclusion" of a composition:

sen.j: 「京都三条糸屋の娘
sen.e: "There are the daughters of a fiber manufacturer in Sanjo, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "There are the daughters of a fiber manufacturer in Sanjo, Kyoto.
"There are the daughters of a fiber manufacturer in Sanjo, Kyoto.

sen.j: 姉は十八妹は十
sen.e: The elder sister is 18, and younger sister is 15.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The elder sister is 18, and younger sister is 15.
The elder sister is 18, and younger sister is 10.

sen.j: 五諸国大名弓矢で殺す
sen.e: Feudal lords kill with bow and arrow.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Feudal lords kill with bow and arrow.
Feudal lords kill with bow and arrow.

sen.j: 糸屋の娘は目で殺す」
sen.e: The sisters of the fiber manufacturer kill with their eyes."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The sisters of the fiber manufacturer kill with their eyes."
The sisters of the fiber manufacturer kill with their eyes."
